title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Materials Scientists and Engineers

content.rendered:
What is a Materials Scientist and Engineer?

Materials Scientists and Engineers are the engineers behind the development and testing of multi-use materials that make a wide variety of products.

Where does a Materials Scientist and Engineer work?

  • Offices
  • Development labs

How much does a Materials Scientist and Engineer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Materials Scientist and Engineer is $66,741.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Materials Scientists and Engineers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing jobs in materials science.

  • Engineering majors
  • Materials science majors

Explore Materials Scientists and Engineering job opportunities on Handshake.

Materials Scientists and Engineers skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Materials Scientists and Engineers succeed in their work:

  • Strong analytical skills
  • Prior training and strong understanding of scientific principles
  • Strong teamwork skills

What are some common questions about Materials Scientists and Engineers?

Q: What does a Materials Engineer do?

A: While it varies from each specific role to role, most materials engineers are concerned with support design, specifications and standardization, overseeing development of materials and troubleshooting.
